p: Plants have evolved through continuous interaction with microbes, and it is evident that endophytic bacteria play significant roles in improving plant survival and adaptation ( Singh et al., 2017). This review outlines the biotic and abiotic factors that influence community structure and endophytic bacterial distribution and summarizes the beneficial effects of endophytes on their host plants. Such information provides a foundation for further studies and can be applied to obtain better bioactive materials from medicinal plants.
